chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Nigel R Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment and/or schooling.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS

records.addlTxt:
02:07 PM Defendant Nigel R Schultz in court, in custody.  Dennis Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances.  Court questions DE again re: counsel.  DE continues to waive counsel.  Court accepts counsel waiver.  Court notes she has been notified that a victim in 15CF374 wishes to appear by phone and make a statement but doesn't wish her name to be used.  State responds.  DE makes statement, he's not objecting as he already knows who the person is.  Court calls the victim by phone and she will appear by phone for today's hearing.  P.K. makes statement.  State makes recommendations.  State discusses other pending matters w/DE off the record.  State suggests these two sentences run conrcurrent to any other sentences.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court advises DE re: post-conviction relief and WEDS information.  Court advises DE re: voting rights and felony firearms warnings.  State notes off the record conversation he had w/DE re: extended supervision revocations pending in matters in other counties.  Court explains to DE these were the only 2 cases here in Sauk County and they were just probation revocations.

15CF374
Ct 1:
3 years Initial Confinement and 3 years Extended Supervision concurrent to Ct 3 and 16CF1
Ct 3:
5 years Initial Confinement and 5 years Extended Supervision concurrent to Ct 1 and 16CF1

16CF1
Ct 1: 
3 years Initial Confinement and 3 years Extended Supervision concurrent to sentences 15CF374

Any unpaid court obligations to be converted to civil judgments
168 days sentence credit to be applied in each case
DE is eligible for CIP/SAP/ERP
Dodge Correctional
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 22, 2019 at 02:00 pm.

01:32 PM Defendant Nigel R Schultz in court, in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises DE rights to an attorney.  DE does not wish to seek public defender representation.  DE wishes to represent himself.  State requests matter be reset due to seriousness of case.  Court resets matter to allow DE time to seek public defender representation.  DE has received copy of revocation paperwork.

Plea to Count 1.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Victim statement reviewed.  State gives final statement.  Attorney Middleton gives final statement.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:
5 years Probation
Submit DNA sample
Undergo any counseling, treatment and evaluations per agent
Restitution with 10% Surcharge:  Request within 45 days.  Submit to Defendant, if objection, hearing to be set.  
$268.00 Fine/Costs fees and $250.00 DNA surcharge (PAID THRU CLERK OF COURTS) 
Maintain full time employment and or schooling
No contact with victim in 15CF442
Paperwork handed in court.
Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading.

Defendant Nigel R Schultz in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Nigel R Schultz in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Middleton advises of waiver today.  Defendant agrees.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 7, 2016 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Nigel R Schultz in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  DE in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states cases, parties state appearances and status.  Atty Middleton notes matters were set for a plea today but there some more things he needs to discuss w/the State.  Requests a short adjournment.  Court agrees to short adjournment.  Suggests Atty Middleton talk to his assistant after court today.  Atty Ryan notes Atty Middleton is not at fault as he just received some information this morning that he should have received earlier and that will not happen again.  Court orders bond continued in all matters.
Plea hearing on March 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Return date at 03-18-2016 01:00 pm

Defendant Nigel R Schultz in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Defendant Nigel R Schultz in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Middleton states matter isn't resolved.  Requests time to get further reports re: NGI plea.  Bond continued.  Time limits waiver cont'd.  Return date scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 02-05-2016 11:00 am.
Return date at 02-18-2016 01:00 pm.

Defendant Nigel R Schultz appeared by video means with Attorney Tsai. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is represented by Attorney Middleton in another matter.  Has not applied for this case yet.  State request signature bond due to other case bond set in another case.  Attorney Tsai advises as to the age of the defendant.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Time limits waived.  $2000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
